name: Auto-Creation of Compliance Records - Back Office User
description: Compliance records are automatically created via API integration when new compliance entries are created in Focus system, with auto-populated fields that cannot be manually edited

background.text: I am logged in as a Back Office User
the Focus system API integration is active

scenarios.name: Compliance record automatically created from Focus system

steps.text: a new compliance record is created in the Focus system
the API integration processes the new record
a compliance record should be automatically created
the record should appear in the Compliance Dashboard list view
the Overall Status should be set to "non-compliant"

scenarios.name: Auto-populated fields are correctly fetched from Focus

steps.text: a new compliance record exists in Focus with complete data
the record is automatically created via API
the "First Name" field should be populated from Focus
the "Last Name" field should be populated from Focus
the "Email ID" field should be populated from Focus
the COI attachments should be imported from the Attachments Tab

scenarios.name: Auto-populated fields cannot be manually edited

steps.text: I am viewing an auto-created compliance record
I attempt to edit the "First Name" field
the field should be read-only
the "Last Name" field should be read-only
the "Email ID" field should be read-only
the auto-imported attachments should not be editable

scenarios.name: Back Office user can edit requirements and attachments

steps.text: I am viewing an auto-created compliance record
I update the requirements section
I add additional attachments
I click the "Save" button
the requirements should be updated successfully
the new attachments should be saved
the auto-populated fields should remain unchanged

scenarios.name: Default non-compliant status can be updated after review

steps.text: I am viewing an auto-created compliance record with "non-compliant" status
I review the requirements and attachments
I change the Overall Status to "compliant"
I click the "Save" button
the status should be updated to "compliant"
the changes should be reflected in the Compliance Dashboard

scenarios.name: Auto-created record appears in Compliance Dashboard list view

steps.text: multiple compliance records have been auto-created from Focus
I navigate to the Compliance Dashboard
I should see all auto-created records in the list view
each record should display the auto-populated names and email
the default status should show as "non-compliant"

scenarios.name: Manual creation of compliance records is not allowed

steps.text: I am on the Compliance Dashboard
I look for options to manually create a new compliance record
no "Create New" or "Add Record" button should be available
manual creation functionality should not be accessible through the front end

scenarios.name: API integration failure prevents record creation

steps.text: the Focus system API integration is temporarily unavailable
a new compliance record is created in Focus
the record should not be created in the system
an error should be logged for the failed integration
the record should not appear in the Compliance Dashboard

scenarios.name: Incomplete data from Focus system handling

steps.text: a compliance record in Focus has missing required fields
the API attempts to create the record automatically
the system should handle the incomplete data gracefully
an error notification should be generated
the incomplete record should not appear in the dashboard

scenarios.name: Attempting to delete auto-populated attachments fails

steps.text: I am viewing an auto-created compliance record with COI attachments
I attempt to delete the auto-imported COI attachment
the deletion should be prevented
an error message should indicate the attachment cannot be removed
the attachment should remain in the record

scenarios.name: Large volume of Focus records processed correctly

steps.text: multiple compliance records are created simultaneously in Focus
the API processes all records in batch
all records should be created successfully
each record should maintain data integrity
the Compliance Dashboard should display all records

scenarios.name: Focus record with maximum allowed attachments

steps.text: a Focus compliance record has the maximum number of allowed attachments
the record is auto-created via API
all attachments should be imported successfully
the system should handle the maximum attachment limit
the record should be created without errors
a compliance record already exists from a previous Focus integration
the same record is sent again through the API
the system should detect the duplicate
no duplicate record should be created
the existing record should remain unchanged
multiple auto-created compliance records exist with different statuses
I filter the dashboard by "non-compliant" status
I select multiple records for bulk status update
I should be able to update multiple records simultaneously
the filtered view should update to reflect the changes

gherkin_content:
Feature: Auto-Creation of Compliance Records - Back Office User
  Compliance records are automatically created via API integration when new compliance entries are created in Focus system, with auto-populated fields that cannot be manually edited

  Background:
    Given I am on the application
    And I am logged in as a Back Office User
    And the Focus system API integration is active

  @smoke @positive
  Scenario: Compliance record automatically created from Focus system
    Given a new compliance record is created in the Focus system
    When the API integration processes the new record
    Then a compliance record should be automatically created
    And the record should appear in the Compliance Dashboard list view
    And the Overall Status should be set to "non-compliant"

  @positive @integration
  Scenario: Auto-populated fields are correctly fetched from Focus
    Given a new compliance record exists in Focus with complete data
    When the record is automatically created via API
    Then the "First Name" field should be populated from Focus
    And the "Last Name" field should be populated from Focus
    And the "Email ID" field should be populated from Focus
    And the COI attachments should be imported from the Attachments Tab

  @positive @validation
  Scenario: Auto-populated fields cannot be manually edited
    Given I am viewing an auto-created compliance record
    When I attempt to edit the "First Name" field
    Then the field should be read-only
    And the "Last Name" field should be read-only
    And the "Email ID" field should be read-only
    And the auto-imported attachments should not be editable

  @positive @editing
  Scenario: Back Office user can edit requirements and attachments
    Given I am viewing an auto-created compliance record
    When I update the requirements section
    And I add additional attachments
    And I click the "Save" button
    Then the requirements should be updated successfully
    And the new attachments should be saved
    And the auto-populated fields should remain unchanged

  @positive @status
  Scenario: Default non-compliant status can be updated after review
    Given I am viewing an auto-created compliance record with "non-compliant" status
    When I review the requirements and attachments
    And I change the Overall Status to "compliant"
    And I click the "Save" button
    Then the status should be updated to "compliant"
    And the changes should be reflected in the Compliance Dashboard

  @positive @dashboard
  Scenario: Auto-created record appears in Compliance Dashboard list view
    Given multiple compliance records have been auto-created from Focus
    When I navigate to the Compliance Dashboard
    Then I should see all auto-created records in the list view
    And each record should display the auto-populated names and email
    And the default status should show as "non-compliant"

  @negative @validation
  Scenario: Manual creation of compliance records is not allowed
    Given I am on the Compliance Dashboard
    When I look for options to manually create a new compliance record
    Then no "Create New" or "Add Record" button should be available
    And manual creation functionality should not be accessible through the front end

  @negative @integration
  Scenario: API integration failure prevents record creation
    Given the Focus system API integration is temporarily unavailable
    When a new compliance record is created in Focus
    Then the record should not be created in the system
    And an error should be logged for the failed integration
    And the record should not appear in the Compliance Dashboard

  @negative @data-validation
  Scenario: Incomplete data from Focus system handling
    Given a compliance record in Focus has missing required fields
    When the API attempts to create the record automatically
    Then the system should handle the incomplete data gracefully
    And an error notification should be generated
    And the incomplete record should not appear in the dashboard

  @negative @attachment
  Scenario: Attempting to delete auto-populated attachments fails
    Given I am viewing an auto-created compliance record with COI attachments
    When I attempt to delete the auto-imported COI attachment
    Then the deletion should be prevented
    And an error message should indicate the attachment cannot be removed
    And the attachment should remain in the record

  @edge-case @performance
  Scenario: Large volume of Focus records processed correctly
    Given multiple compliance records are created simultaneously in Focus
    When the API processes all records in batch
    Then all records should be created successfully
    And each record should maintain data integrity
    And the Compliance Dashboard should display all records

  @edge-case @boundary
  Scenario: Focus record with maximum allowed attachments
    Given a Focus compliance record has the maximum number of allowed attachments
    When the record is auto-created via API
    Then all attachments should be imported successfully
    And the system should handle the maximum attachment limit
    And the record should be created without errors

  @edge-case @duplicate
  Scenario: Duplicate compliance record prevention
    Given a compliance record already exists from a previous Focus integration
    When the same record is sent again through the API
    Then the system should detect the duplicate
    And no duplicate record should be created
    And the existing record should remain unchanged

  @alternative @workflow
  Scenario: Alternative workflow through dashboard filtering
    Given multiple auto-created compliance records exist with different statuses
    When I filter the dashboard by "non-compliant" status
    And I select multiple records for bulk status update
    Then I should be able to update multiple records simultaneously
    And the filtered view should update to reflect the changes
